intro: [WRONG START] Melica crectica var. laconiae, commonly known as the Laconian brome, is a perennial grass native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as fields and slopes. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is adapted to withstand drought conditions. This variety is of interest in botanical studies due to its ecological significance and resilience in arid environments.
